title.narrative: SWE-2006-30 Giardia in developing countries: from stool to new diagnostic tools via genome sequencing
SWE-2006-30 Giardia in developing countries: from stool to new diagnostic tools via genome sequencing

description.narrative: Main goals: 1. Develop new tools for rapid diagnosis and typing of Giardia 2. Determine if there is a strain-dependent genetic basis for the variability in clinical outcome of human giardiasis. Approach: State of the art, sequencing technologies will be combined with unique clinical material and newly established methods for in vitro characterization of Giardia virulence. This is a continuation of the ongoing SIDA project SWE-2006-0030. Purpose of this study: 1. Identification of the major Giardia genotypes in León, Nicaragua and Kampala, Uganda. 2. Isolation of Giardia parasites from fecal samples and establishment of new in vitro cultures of Giardia. 3. Genome sequencing of new Giardia isolates, comparative genomics and in vitro characterization. 4. Development of new tools for rapid diagnosis and typing of Giardia.
